q: based on reports of leaked excerpts, it appears the former secretary of defense has few regrets when it comes to the President Bush administration's handling of the Iraq War. The Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today if Saddam Hussein had remained in power, Donald Rumsfeld writes, according to portions of the book obtained by Jonathan Karl of ABC News. Donald Rumsfeld does not shy away from criticism though, including suggestions that more troops should

speed up decision-making at the Internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google said that Mr Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. talkback No responses currently. OUT: NO SALES: NO ARCHIVE: Andy Coulson denies any knowledge of the hacking, but admitted he'd committed a cardinal sin for a back room operator- he became the story. Andy Coulson said continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110 percent needed in his role as Downing Street communications chief. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman, it's time to move on."

ago LONDON( AFP)- British Tony Blair David Cameron began looking for a new media chief Saturday to replace Andy Coulson after he quit over a tabloid phone-hacking row, in a test for the nine-month-old government. So far, our worst day in government, a senior David Cameron aide told The Guardian after Andy Coulson quit Friday, bowing to pressure over what he knew about hacking at the News of the World( NOTW) when he was its editor.
